common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to AVX2 incompatibility
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing crashes or inability to launch PiecesOS after a recent update. The issue stems from a new dependency requiring AVX2 support, which is not available on all processors. The Pieces team is aware of the problem and is actively working on a patch to address the compatibility issue. A fix is expected to be released shortly.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @gonzososa is experiencing issues launching PiecesOS on macOS (Arm architecture) after updating to 11.1.0.
* The issue seems related to the new vector library having avx2 issues on different systems.
* Pieces team is actively working on a solution.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS is unable to launch on macOS (Arm architecture) for @gonzososa.
* The issue is potentially caused by avx2 incompatibility in the new vector library.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team is releasing a new version of the application with a solution for the avx2 issues.
* The user is requested to provide information about their CPU for further debugging.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being addressed by the Pieces team.
* A new version with a solution is expected to be released soon.
* User's CPU information is needed for further investigation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user has provided their CPU information: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU @ 2.50GHz.
* Other users are also experiencing similar issues (see related issues).

## Summary in a Nutshell

@gonzososa is having trouble launching PiecesOS due to avx2 incompatibility. The Pieces team is working on a fix and expects to release a new version soon. The user has provided their CPU information, and the team may reach out for further assistance. Other users are experiencing similar issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Discussion:

**Problem:** 
- User (@GetReal444) encountered an error message related to AVX2 not being supported on their processor.
- This error prevented Pieces OS from launching.

**Key Points:**
- The issue stemmed from a database service requirement for AVX2 hardware support.
- This affected multiple users beyond the initial report.
- The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and proposed a solution.

**Solutions:**
- The Pieces team worked on a patch to address the dependency issue.
- Users were requested to provide system specifications for further troubleshooting.

**Outcome:**
- A fix is expected to be released within 24-48 hours. 
- The patch will address the AVX2 dependency issue.

**Current Status:**
- Patch is under development and targeted for release by the end of the next day (2025-02-14).

**Additional Notes:**
- This issue is related to other reported issues (#624, #625).
- The Pieces team is actively working on a resolution.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS version 11.1.1 due to stricter hardware requirements.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces OS update 11.1.1 is not compatible with some users' hardware. 
* The support bot initially provided unhelpful resources, causing frustration for users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested users to provide logs to diagnose the issue.
* Pieces will release a patch within 24-48 hours to resolve the compatibility issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A patch is expected to be released by the end of February 14th, 2025, to address the compatibility issues.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue is related to another open issue (#625). 
* Users are advised to be patient and provide the requested logs to assist with troubleshooting.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch, often stuck at "ensure core dependencies" step, particularly on MacOS. This was linked to incompatible hardware, MacOS versions, and conflicts with OneDrive. Solutions included reinstalling using specific builds, updating to the latest version (11.1.1), resolving OneDrive conflicts, and providing logs to support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Point:** User PASimmons reported an issue with Pieces for developers not running on their M1 chip Mac.

**Problem:** The previously working build was not compatible with Apple Silicon processors.

**Solution:** The user was advised to uninstall and reinstall Pieces using the Apple Silicon builds from pieces.app. They confirmed the issue was resolved after the reinstall.

**Outcome:** The issue was resolved by installing the correct build for the user's hardware.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation [#613](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/613)

**Key points raised:**

* **Multiple users reported issues with PiecesOS:** The app wouldn't fully start, getting stuck in the "ensure core dependencies" step, and the system tray icon wouldn't appear.
* **Problems identified:**
    * The issue was more prevalent in MacOS Monterey.
    * Some users experienced this problem after installing Atlas OS alongside Windows.
    * OneDrive syncing caused issues for one user.
* **Solutions proposed/implemented:**
    * **Windows users:**
        * Restart the Pieces for Developers Desktop application.
        * Send user logs to support: c:/Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs
    * **All users:**
        * Manually reinstall the app using a different download link.
        * Take screenshots of specific files and folders.
        * Update to version 11.1.1.
        * For OneDrive conflict, remove the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive or contact support.
* **Current status/outcome:**
    * The issue was resolved for most users with the release of version 11.1.1.
    * One user reported the issue was still present after the update and scheduled a call for further troubleshooting.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue conversation included some off-topic messages from Shamas-Habib, which were addressed by rogierlegit.
* Mark Widman (mark-at-pieces) provided updates and solutions throughout the conversation.

## Conclusion

The issue with PiecesOS not starting properly was resolved for most users with the release of version 11.1.1. However, if you are still experiencing this issue, there are additional steps you can take, or you can contact Pieces support for further assistance.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with PiecesOS, including failure to launch, download models, or complete updates. These problems often manifested as the app getting stuck during startup, particularly on MacOS. Solutions involved updating to the latest version (11.1.1), providing logs to support, reinstalling the app, or resolving conflicts with OneDrive.

related_issues.title: Models Download Fail
related_issues.text:
Models Download Fail
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not able to download any of the models for ollama.
[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Problem:** 
* User surya-sengupta reported that Ollama failed to install in Pieces, even after updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 and performing a clean reinstall. 

**Key points:**
* The problem initially seemed resolved after updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0, but then reoccurred.
* User provided logs from both com.pieces.os/production/Support and com.pieces.pfd.

**Solutions:**
* Pieces Support Bot suggested checking similar issues and documentation, but this did not resolve the problem.
* brian-at-pieces advised updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0, but the issue persisted.
* mark-at-pieces requested additional support logs from com.pieces.os/production/Support. 

**Current status:**
* User provided the requested support logs. The team at Pieces is likely investigating the logs to identify the root cause and propose a definitive solution.

**Outcome:**
* To be determined.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch or update, often getting stuck on "ensure core dependencies." This primarily affected macOS Monterey and systems with potential conflicts like Atlas OS or OneDrive. Solutions included restarting the app, reinstalling, updating to version 11.1.1, resolving OneDrive conflicts, and providing logs to support.

related_issues.title: Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application
related_issues.text:
Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application
### Software

Release Notes (code.pieces.app/updates)

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

win 10

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

pieces for developers .....need out in french ,,,,,, where ???
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Point:** User @CryptoIngenieur1 proposed localizing the Pieces App.

**Problem Identified:** The app currently lacks support for multiple languages.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** 
* The Pieces team is actively researching localization options.
* No specific implementation timeline is available yet.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The issue remains open, indicating ongoing investigation.
* Users are encouraged to stay updated for further developments.

**Additional Notes:**
* The first comment is an auto-reply from the bot.
* The second comment is from a Pieces team member.

**Overall:** 
The Pieces team acknowledges the need for localization and is actively exploring solutions. However, a concrete implementation timeline is not yet available.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS performance and freezing issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing high CPU usage, unresponsiveness, and freezing with the Pieces OS desktop app, particularly on Linux Mint. This is likely due to the LTM-1 algorithm and a known Flutter issue. Solutions include disabling LTM-1, using cloud processing, and disabling the on-screen keyboard as a workaround.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS has high CPU usage even when idle and no LLM output is processing. Closing the desktop app or any other app with integrations like VScode makes no difference. The CPU usage sometimes drops down to 0% but immediately picks up back to 90%+. 
I dont have any local LLMs or any of the browser plugins installed. I am aware that similar issue was raised last year and was supposed to be fixed in 11.1.0, maybe it wasn't fixed entirely.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3bedac0a-c9aa-48b9-a86a-6a3c4698d263
## Github Issue Summary: 

**Problem:** @94tejas reported PiecesOS using too much RAM and experiencing unresponsiveness, likely due to the LTM-1 algorithm.

**Key Points:**

* LTM-1 is the long-term memory engine within Pieces, impacting resource usage.
* User reported high CPU and RAM usage, possibly on a lower-powered device.

**Solutions:**

* **Short-term:** Disable LTM-1 and/or enable cloud processing for ML to reduce device load. 
* **Long-term:** Pieces team is actively working on optimizing the LTM-1 algorithm for lower resource usage.

**Outcome:** 

* Turning off LTM-1 resolved the issue for the user, allowing them to use Pieces effectively.
* Continued development on LTM-1 optimization will aim to improve resource efficiency and user experience.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint

**Key points raised:**

* User (@94tejas) reported the app freezing issue.
* Support bot identified the issue and suggested related resources.
* @mack-at-pieces identified the root cause as a known Flutter issue.

**Problems identified:**

* Specific versions of Linux Mint are affected by a Flutter issue causing app freezes, especially when text fields are used with on-screen keyboards.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Disabling the on-screen keyboard in accessibility settings was identified as a workaround.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is closed, with the workaround in place. 
* The team will monitor the upstream Flutter issue and apply any fix when available. 

**Additionally:**

* Related GitHub issues and resources were provided for further assistance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS version 11.1.1 due to stricter hardware requirements.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces OS update 11.1.1 is not compatible with some users' hardware. 
* The support bot initially provided unhelpful resources, causing frustration for users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested users to provide logs to diagnose the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A patch is expected to be released by the end of February 14th, 2025, to address the compatibility issues.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue is related to another open issue (#625). 
* Users are advised to be patient and provide the requested logs to assist with troubleshooting.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch failures:** The most frequent and active issues revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch after the recent update, particularly due to AVX2 incompatibility. Focus on resolving this quickly to reduce user frustration and support ticket volume.

**Investigate and address MacOS-specific launch issues:** A significant number of launch problems occur on MacOS, potentially related to hardware incompatibility, MacOS versions, and conflicts with OneDrive.  Investigate these issues further and provide clear solutions or workarounds.

**Optimize PiecesOS performance on Linux Mint:** Users are experiencing high CPU usage and freezing on Linux Mint. Address the LTM-1 algorithm's impact on resources and investigate the known Flutter issue causing unresponsiveness.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** The recent update introduced stricter hardware requirements, catching some users off guard. Clearly communicate these requirements on the download page, release notes, and during the update process to manage user expectations.

**Review and update support bot responses:** Some users found the support bot's responses unhelpful. Review and update its knowledge base to ensure it provides accurate and relevant information, reducing the need for human intervention.
